snippet: The Army is remaking its recruiting structure amid concerns over whether budget cuts scheduled for 2013 will make joining the service a tougher sell.
abstract: United States Army is remaking its recruiting structure, transitioning from a war-time strategy that put a top priority on filling ranks quickly; changes come amid concerns over whether budget cuts scheduled for 2013 will make joining the service a tougher sell.
lead_paragraph: The Army is remaking its recruiting structure amid concerns over whether budget cuts scheduled for 2013 will make joining the service a tougher sell.
